Snow White is in my opinion a bad movie on an artistic point of view. The plot is pretty much foreseeable, the characters are stereotypes, the editing too. The movie was decent produced though.
That being said, as a viewer I was still taken by this classic Disney film when I rewatched it lately: I think one can’t be  born and raised enough with certain landscapes to not get emotionally touched by them.
These are some impression from my last watching:

What is left of Planet Earth is populated by a few poor and starving rag-tag survivors. They must eat bugs and insects, or whatever they can find. The Asia Complex has become the planet's Kingdom.
